decision_conditions: These mature Copper Beech trees (T2 and T4) are situated in the rear garden of the property to the south with T4 being about 5m away from the property and the other tree (T2) being some 18.1m away from the property.  Both of these trees do not appear to have been significantly pruned before and, as a result, they have retained an attractive, natural looking crown, typical for this species. The trees are highly visible and have a high amenity value making a significant contribution to the visual amenity and arboreal character of the local area.

The reasons given are not viewed as justified reasons for carrying out this level of crown thinning on these trees. These works would unnecessarily introduce multiple wounds to the crowns of  these trees which would likely lead to infection. Additionally, the proposed work would be detrimental to the amenity value of these trees and would more generally have a detrimental impact on their natural appearance.
The crowns of these trees are not cur
The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.

Statutory crown lifting of trees: This does not require formal consent of the Council if the clearance only involves the removal of branches to give a separation between the footway and the tips of the lowest branches by up to 2.3m or the carriageway by up to 5.2m.
description: To crown thin one Copper Beech by approximately 30% (T4) on TPO 80 and to crown thin one Copper Beech by approximately 30% and crown lift to approximately 5.2m over road by tip pruning (T2) on TPO 80.
